flawed_nl_solution:
The cheap gym cost 10*12=$<<10*12=120>>120 for monthly fees
So the total cost was 120+50=$<<120+50=170>>170
The more expensive gym cost 3*10=$<<3*10=30>>30 per month
That means the sign-up fee was 30*4=$<<30*4=120>>120
The monthly fees for the expensive gym comes out to 30*12=$<<30*12=306>>306 per year
So the total cost for the expensive gym was 306+120=$<<306+120=426>>426
So his total cost was 426+170=$<<426+170=596>>596

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 360, not 306. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
